div.p:
The mission of Capital Preparatory Schools is to provide historically disadvantaged students with the
college and career readiness skills needed to become responsible and engaged citizens for social justice.

div.p:
Capital Preparatory Schools community members should
always act in accordance with our Learner Expectations,
not only in the academic sense, but also in their behavior,
language, and attitudes. The following CPREP acronym
outlines these behavioral expectations:

Collaborators
Problem Solvers
Researchers
Empathetic Citizens
Pillars of Knowledge

At Capital Preparatory Schools, our children are more than scholars - they are
preparing to be agents of change. Our Social Justice College Preparatory focus
develops students' skills to succeed in college, career, and life beyond.

p.span: Year Round, Extended Day, College Preparatory Model
Access to College Courses while in High School

div.p:
100% of Capital Prep graduates accepted to
4-year colleges or universities since 2005.

div.p:
Capital Preparatory Schools does not discriminate in any employment practice, education program, or educational activity on the basis of race, color, religious creed, sex, age,
national origin, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or expression, disability (including but not limited to, intellectual disability), genetic information, or any
other basis prohibited by the state of Connecticut and/or federal non-discrimination laws in the school's programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and
other designated youth groups. Capital Prep's Title IX/504 Coordinator is Tammy Cassile tammy.cassile@capitalprepharbor.org
